chapter.title: Introduction to Knowledge
chapter.para: Knowledge is an intuitive full featured web-based application designed to be used by individuals, and organizations who need to manage their medical terminology needs to improve healthcare delivery and reimbursement. The following chapters describe the functionality that enables the creation of new content, the modification of content, and releasing content to satisfy our customers needs.

Knowledge is based on Logica's Open Source project Solor. Mind Computing has taken the Solor project and created Knowledge a web-based application. Knowledge also utilizes Solor's common model approach to integrating Meaningful Use Standards, such as SNOMED CT, LOINC and RxNorm. Additionally, Knowledge can also integrate locally created content and import this created content into the Knowledge application where this terminology can be integrated with Meaningful Use Standards. Knowledge can load Meaningful Use Standards and locally created terminologies without utilizing Solor's common model.

The Knowledge application has 3 components the: Editor, Manager, and a Terminology Server. The Knowledge Editor provides all authoring functionality, such as creating new concepts, modify concepts, creating value sets, modifying value sets, classifying, search, mapping and exporting content. The Knowledge Manager provides the functionality to create new users and modify a user's role the user has the administrator role. Our Terminology Server supports runtime terminology requirements. This includes a complete implementation of Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) Application Programming Interface (API) as an enterprise cloud computing service.
